responsibilities: Developing, implementing, and maintaining scientific software
Participating in the organization of CCB and Flatiron-wide collaborative activities including seminars, workshops, and meetings
Participating in the preparation of manuscripts for publication and presentations at scientific conferences
Sharing expertise and providing training and guidance to CCB staff and visitors as needed
skills: Demonstrated abilities in mathematical modeling, analysis, and/or scientific computation
Proficiency in scientific software and algorithm development
Expertise in data analysis and inference, and image analysis
Ability to conduct original and outstanding research in computational biology
Expertise in computational methods, data analysis, software and algorithm development, modeling machine learning, and scientific simulation
Ability to work well in an interdisciplinary environment and collaborate with experimentalists
Strong oral and written communication, data documentation, and presentation skills
analysis: The job responsibilities and skills listed focus primarily on computational biology, scientific research, and software development. The responsibilities include performing research, developing scientific software, and participating in collaborative activities and mentorship. The skills required emphasize mathematical modeling, scientific computation, data analysis, and algorithm development. While there is mention of machine learning, which can be related to AI, there is no specific mention of Generative AI or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus seems to be more on computational biology and scientific research rather than on developing or working with GenAI or LLMs.
